did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Warren County (Va.) Miscellaneous Records, 1866-1914 (bulk 1890-1914). Local government records collection, Warren County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Warren County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Warren County was named for Joseph Warren, the revolutionary patriot who sent Paul Revere and William Dawes on their famous rides and who was killed at the Battle of Bunker Hill. The county was formed from Frederick and Shenandoah counties in 1836.
The Board of Dental Examiners certify dentist and dental hygienist who meet their requirements to work in Virginia.
Board of Medical Examiners certify physicians and surgeons who meet their requirements to work in Virginia.

An estray is an animal who's owner's name is unknown. An Estray Book is a register giving public notice of valuable, tame animals, either lost or found wandering and presumed escaped from their owners. These records allow the owners to reclaim their animals

A lien is a claim, encumbrance, or a charge on property for payment of some debt, obligation, or duty. A Mechanic's lien is a claim created by state statutes for the purpose of securing payment of the price or value of work performed and materials furnished in erecting, improving or repairing a building or other structures.

A Docket is a brief record of proceedings in a court of justice. It usually gives the style of the suit and the date the court first dealt with it. Sometime it gives the date the suit was removed from the docket.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Warren County (Va.) Miscellaneous Records, 1866-1914 (bulk 1890-1914), consists of Certificates of the Board of Dental Examiners, Certificates from Board of Medical Examiners, Mechanic Lien Docket, and Estray Book.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Warren County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm."

did.unittitle: Certificates of Board of Dental Examiners, 1890-1906

scopecontent.p: This volume contains a list people certificated to perform dental work in Warren County.

did.unittitle: Certificates from Board of Medical Examiners, 1890

scopecontent.p: This volume contains a list of people certified to work as physicians and surgeons in Warren County.
This docket contains information about suits heard in court to recover payment for services or materials.
This volume contains a list of animals, found in Warren County, whose owners' names are unknown.
